messages.message: The model is performing inconsistently with passengers wearing transparent masks. Do we have specific test cases for this?

replies.message: Not yet, but I’ll create synthetic examples and flag this for testing tomorrow.
I’ll check if we can source real-world samples from the airport’s database.

messages.message: Quick note: Some passengers with beards are being flagged incorrectly. Could this be an edge case in the occlusion module?

replies.message: It’s possible. I’ll validate this against the misclassification logs.
Let’s add more diversity to the training dataset for facial hair variations.

messages.message: The airport staff mentioned delays in processing group photos at the boarding gates. Adding this as a priority for next week’s sprint.

replies.message: Would splitting group photos into individual frames improve processing times?
Yes, I’ll prototype a script for that.

messages.message: Reminder: The QA session tomorrow will focus on handling poor lighting conditions in terminal zones. Make sure your test scenarios are uploaded to Confluence by tonight.
Are we planning to evaluate passenger throughput after integrating the fallback mechanism?

replies.message: Yes, that’s already included in the next round of tests.

messages.message: The initial results from testing multi-person scenarios with overlapping bounding boxes show a 10% false positive rate. I’ll adjust the IoU thresholds.
I’ve flagged 15 cases where passengers with high-contrast facial features were misclassified. Adding them to the bug tracker for debugging.

replies.message: Do these cases involve specific lighting conditions?
Yes, most were recorded in dimly lit zones.

messages.message: Do we have metrics on how facial recognition accuracy changes during peak vs. off-peak hours?

replies.message: Not yet, but I’ll run a comparison using the logs from Terminal 3.

messages.message: The Confluence page for tracking thermal imaging integration is live: https://confluence.nvidia.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=223456. Let’s populate it with initial results after this week’s tests.
